reviews.review_msg: Fall 2021 he would not record lectures, this made it difficult to keep up cuz the lectures are long and dense. The tutorial participation/project are easy to get a good grade on. The memos take a lot of time but are fairly straight forward if you have good lecture notes. The final is ridiculous, it is so insanely long and you will run out of time

He deserves higher. He is lecture heavy but for a reason, he will go over each reading so if you fall behind it is okay and it helps to better understand the readings. He will also emphasize important topics in lecture so you always know what will be on tests or case comments. Take really good notes and you will do well.

Dr. Fehr has an incredibly impressive background and his lectures were even better because of that. He was able to bring the material to life with real examples and his experiences as a lawyer. The course material itself can be quite dense and at times hard to grasp but going to office hours seriously makes all the difference in this class.
418 was a very hard course and the marking is tough.

THIS PROF IS BY FAR THE WORST PROF I'VE EVER HAD. What he expects from students is ridiculously unrealistic and the amount of time given for exams makes it nearly impossible to finish. I genuinely do not understand how he has any good ratings. DO NOT take this class with him ABORT AT ALL COSTS!!!

The course in general was okay. However, the final exam was beyond unreasonable. For the two previous assignments we were given weeks notice to work on it. For the final exam that contained nearly twice the amount of work we only had 3 hrs plus an essay. Felt impossible to finish.

Had him online for Fall 2020, lectures were mandatory because he didn't do recordings to encourage attendance, posts slides before the lecture.. But his lectures are really good at summarizing the textbook material and cites cases that will help you for the memos, as well he will give hints on what cases/statutes to focus on for memos/final.

Colton is extremely knowledgeable at his subject, which allows a very in-depth course. The only problem that I found was that sometimes it is hard to catch everything he says, as he sometimes goes over topics quickly if nobody has questions. I would suggest having the pp notes ready beforehand and just add the extra things he mentions.

I took this class in Spring when it was online, hands down one of the best professors. He was a prosecutor so he is very informative and teaches in an organized & clear manner. He is always accessible outside of class and wants students to genuinely learn and understand the content. Highly recommend professor Fehr.

TAKE ANY CLASS YOU CAN WITH HIM!!! he's super helpful and provides a lot of feedback so you can do well in his class. He's a hidden gem at SFU and I honestly wish I could take more classes with him and I suck at criminal law.

He didn't provide any criteria as to how to write the memorandum and only provided a sample answer after the assignment was due. They don't tell you what legal rules or laws to apply into the memorandum scenario, but if you use the wrong one, you won't get a good grade even partial marks.

The course content is obviously challenging; however, it is manageable and Dr. Fehr is very approachable during the lectures and is flexible for office hours. Tips: prepare case briefs before every lec. for the new case law (already cited in his lec. slides & that way you wont cram for the final exam!), start the memos early, & go to office hours

His lecture slides on case law, Criminal Code and Charter provisions were explained well. He indicated which topics would be tested. It was difficult to work on the first memorandum, since he didn't provide a sample, but he produced answers for the first memo that outlined expectations for the second memo. Use his lecture slides for the final exam!

Final exam is open book but requires memorization of 11 week's worth of legal rules/case law. I only finished in time because I studied harder than I ever have. You MUST know the legal rules and cases associated with each set of rules. Pro tip: type all notes in a word doc and "ctrl F" to search doc for answer on exam will save your life, trust me.
We got 3 hours to complete the final and I found it kinda impossible to do because there's 2 parts which was the memo and a "short" essay

Colton is awesome and I Found the memos really fun but stressful. You really got to know all the cases which is quite overwhelming but go to him for help he is great and only way you will do good. Marking depends on the TA and can make or break your grade. Also the final is impossible to do within 3 hrs due to it being cumulative with 2 parts

He likes to ramble and he expects his students to all be lawyers when it comes to the memo assignments. I get this "I'm better than you" feeling from him. I also don't understand why he tells us to purchase the textbook and then say that it is not good and is essentially useless.

Professor Fehr is extremely knowledgeable and truly cares about his students. Attending his office hours is helpful as he is more than willing to point you in the right direction. If youre passionate about the law and constitutional issues, you will enjoy Fehrs engaging and thought-provoking lectures.

Professor Fehr is a great professor and explains things quite clearly. Attending lecture is a must as he gives hints on exams and assignments. The assignments can be tough and require lots of critical thinking but as long as you understand the material it should not be too hard. He's a great professor, highly recommend! But get ready to do work!

It was his first time teaching at SFU and he honestly taught very well and was resourceful and accessible. Content was heavy but he explained it well in lectures and gave examples. Pay attention to lectures because he will give clues about assignments and exams. Listen to every detail and focus on every point in the criteria and go to office hours!
